required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Plyometric Training on Endurance and Explosive Strength in Cricket Players
clinical_study.official_title: Effects of Plyometric Training on Endurance and Explosive Strength in Cricket Players

brief_summary.textblock: This study will help to understand the effects of plyometric training on endurance and explosive strength in cricket players.

detailed_description.textblock: It will consist of combination of plyometric training with warm up and cool down including Squat to Squat Jump, Lunge to Plyo Lunge, Step Jack to Star Jumps, Plank to Plyo Spider Lunge, Plank to Frogger Frequency = 2 days per week for 2 weeks and then 4 days per week after 2nd week to 4th week, Intensity =500 jumps, Time = 30 min.

primary_outcome.description: Vertical jump tests is used to measure lower limb explosive power by measuring the height a client is able to jump in centimetre (cm). Attempt to touch the wall at the highest point of the jump. The difference in distance between the standing reach height and the jump height is the score. The best of three attempts is recorded.
This test is used to measures endurance
This test is used to measure explosive strength for upper extremity.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Plyometric training with warm up and cool down
arm_group.description: Plyometric training will include following exercises. Squat to Squat Jump Lunge to Plyo Lunge Step Jack to Star Jumps Plank to Plyo Spider Lunge Plank to Frogger

arm_group.arm_group_label: Conventional training with warm up & cool down
arm_group.description: Conventional training will include following exercises. Squats Single leg squat Cork hip lift Press ups

intervention.intervention_name: Plyometric training with warm up and cool down
intervention.description: These Include Squat to Squat Jump, Lunge to Plyo Lunge, Step Jack to Star Jumps, Plank to Plyo Spider Lunge, Plank to Frogger Frequency = 2 days per week for 2 weeks and then 4 days per week after 2nd week to 4th week Intensity =500 jumps Time = 30 min
intervention.arm_group_label: Plyometric training with warm up and cool down
intervention.other_name: These Squat to Squat Jump, Lunge to Plyo Lunge, Step Jack to Star Jumps, Plank to Plyo Spider Lunge, Plank to Frogger

intervention.intervention_name: Conventional training with warm up & cool down
intervention.description: These include Squats, Single leg squat, Cork hip lift, Press ups, Normal warm-up time 15 min before game.
intervention.arm_group_label: Conventional training with warm up & cool down

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Active Male cricket players, age between 18-30 years.
- Playing from last 6 months.
- Normal BMI athletes
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of trauma/injury in last 2 months.
- Playing for less than 6 months.
- Over-weighted or underweighted athletes
- Any co-morbidity
- Cardiorespiratory issues like asthma
- Hypertension or Diabetes
- Meniscus or ACL/PCL/LCL/MCL injured patient
- Ankle sprain in last 6 month

facility.name: Cricket clubs located in Islamabad and Rawalpindi
